definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Je 2:5 = 2Ki 17:15 they went after vanity [[וַיֶּהְבָָּלוּ]] and became vain, Ps 62:11 [[וּבְגׇזֵל]] [[אַל־תֶּהְבָָּלוּ]] do not become vain (i.e. be demoralized) by robbery; with cogn. acc. Job 27:12 [[לָמָּה]] [[זֶה הֶבֶל תֶּהְבָָּלוּ]] why do ye become vain with vanity (i.e. shew yourselves utterly vain) ?

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: cause to become vain Je 23:16 (of false prophets) [[מַהְבִּלִים הֵמָּה אֶתְכֶם]] i.e. fill you with vain hopes.
